prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's interest in reading different kinds of online articles.
For example, you might be interested in articles about some topics, but not about others.
prompt.task_description: your preferences of what kinds of online articles you would like to read
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of article headline and descriptions, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned what you like and dislike.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you would like to read the following articles: "yes" if you would, "no" if you would not.

conversation_history.message: What types of online communities or forums do you actively participate in, and what draws you to those specific topics or discussions?
What specific subreddits do you follow on Reddit, and what about those topics or communities appeals to you?
I follow UFC, PinkOmega, ThailandTourism. I read about MMA and life in Thailand.
What other topics outside of MMA and Thailand do you enjoy reading about, and why do these topics interest you?
I follow nosleeo, which is a place where other users share scary stories. They're fun to read in bed at night with the lights off.
What other hobbies or interests do you have that you haven't mentioned yet, and how do you typically engage with these interests online?
If we're talking online, I enjoy playing League of Legends. I use that subreddit as well, although not often. I really only engage by playing.
What types of online content or resources do you seek out to improve your skills or knowledge in League of Legends, and are there any other games or gaming communities you're interested in?
I generally just read about the state of the game and how it affects everyone. I improve by actively playing when I have leisure time.
What other forms of entertainment or media do you enjoy online, such as podcasts, YouTube channels, or blogs, and what draws you to these specific sources or topics?
I like LofiGirl on YouTube. Fantastic music for every occasion.
What types of articles or blogs do you enjoy reading about current events or specific subjects, and how do these sources influence your understanding or perspective on these topics?
I only see current events by randomly browsing Reddit. I don't search for them.
What types of books, documentaries, or educational content do you enjoy exploring online, and how do these resources contribute to your personal or professional growth?

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: New York Times
Title: In Norway, the Electric Vehicle Future Has Already Arrived
Description: About 80 percent of new cars sold in Norway are battery-powered. As a result, the air is cleaner, the streets are quieter and the grid hasn’t collapsed. But problems with unreliable chargers persist.
evaluation_results.label: no

query_prompt.content:
Your task is to learn what topics a user is interested in reading online article about. People's interests are broad, so you should seek to understand their interests across many topics; in other words, go for breadth rather than depth. Do not assume a user has given a complete answer to any question, so make sure to keep probing different types of interests.

Previous questions:
- [Q] -> [A]

Generate the most informative open-ended question that, when answered, will reveal the most about the desired behavior beyond what has already been queried for above. Make sure your question addresses different aspects of the user's interests than the questions that have already been asked. At the same time however, the question should be bite-sized, and not ask for too much at once. Generate the open-ended question and nothing else:
